abstract.t: Existing Source Address Validation (SAV) schemes can not effectively defend against IP Spoofing DDoS under incremental deployment. This document proposes SAV-based anti-DDoS architecture (SAV-D), a distributed defense architecture to enhance SAV's defense. The main idea of SAV-D is to collect and aggregate more threat data from existing SAV devices and then distribute crucial knowledge to widespread devices, thus significantly expanding defense across the entire network.
